items.sentence: I received a Christmas card from my brother in Italy.
I heard that Tom was traveling with you in Australia.
I heard that both of your grandfathers were plumbers.
Tom would\'ve come to Boston with us if he could\'ve.
Tom would\'ve done that by now if he\'d known how to.
Tom wouldn\'t have done that even if he\'d wanted to.
I wish you were wrong, but I know that you\'re right.
Tom turned on the water faucet, but nothing came out.
Tom isn\'t old enough to get a driver\'s license yet.
At about the same time, Tom was in his room studying.
Did Tom ever say anything to you about what happened?
Did Tom say anything about going to Boston next week?
Did Tom talk to you about his plans for next weekend?
Did you know that Tom was planning to move to Boston?
We climbed higher so that we might get a better view.
We felt relieved when we saw a light in the distance.
We finally made it home at about 2:30 in the morning.
We flew from New York to St. Louis by way of Chicago.
We shouldn\'t judge people based on their appearance.
I would\'ve told you, but Tom made me promise not to.
